alert.note: Alert for Goshen, Middle-Lower North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 18 at 2:45AM MDT until July 18 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR STRONG WEST WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY MONDAY FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST WYOMING AND THE NORTHERN NEBRASKA PANHANDLE... ...A FIRE WEATHER WATCH FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY MONDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WEST WINDS...LOW HUMIDITY AND ISOLATED DRY THUNDERSTORMS... The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 9 PM MDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * HUMIDITY...Afternoon humidity 9 to 15 percent. * WIND...West winds 15 to 20 mph sustained with possible gusts to 30 mph. * HAINES...5 to 6 or Moderate to High potential for rapid fire growth. * THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated dry thunderstorms are possible on Monday afternoon and early evening. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Goshen, Middle-Lower North Platte River Basin
